"HONEY!" I said. I never tried to get in without ID first off, and secondly, I'm not your honey, so don't speak to me like that again! Normally I'm really nice and easy-going, never quick to embarrass others or myself by starting a confrontation, but the way he said that to me felt like he was trying to belittle me and I had to cut that off really quick-like :)

Two of my friends went in and one came back to the other, nicer pool with me while my husband (the guy who has the right to call me honey) ran upstairs to get my license. My friends came back to the nicer pool and explained to me that other than the fact that they have good music, there really isn't a reason to go to liquid.

My husband brought my ID back to me so the girls and I could go listen to some music and try to have a decent time while they went gambling. I figured I'm not going to make a big deal out of the incident earlier, and maybe that guy didn't mean to be rude, so whatevs, we would try out Liquid.  We got in for free, and the drinks were OK. The music was pretty good. A good mix of top 40 and not too much house. The people were really nice, no one was acting drunk or out of control and everyone was getting along and hanging out, so that was really cool. We met a lot of cool people!

THEN, as we were getting out of the pool walking back to our area, some lady  with blonde hair in two braids walks up to my friend (who was just walking back to the other side of the pool) and she purposely bumps into her and says "I'm a security guard here, MOVE!!!!!!"  WOW.....    Yes, I did say something and the lady just turned around and stared at me like I was supposed to be intimidated. That was crazy, seeing as how we were all totally sober, we weren't causing any problems and were just walking. I could see if we were acting crazy and the lady just broke up a fight, but no, everything was totally chill and she must have been in a really bad mood. Like I said, you're not a security guard for the president so calm down.

Anyways here are my personal scores,

music  B

Price of the drinks C (everywhere is expensive, so be prepared and don't get mad)

ambiance C- (not as nice as other places I've been but not ugly)

Service D

Customers B (everyone was pretty cool and not stuck-up)

The whole vibe  C 

If you could find somewhere else that is prettier and has better staff and good music, go to the other place (even if it costs a little bit more)!

Spent a couple of hours @ this place last Sunday. Pleasantly surprised by the place, It was smaller that most other pool lounges but the service was efficient, ambiance very upbeat, great DJ spinning a diverse array of music, super friendly staff, and the good was good. I had a club sandwich, some salad thing, some Bloody Ms...it was great, however, i didn't pay the cover to get in, so not sure of the rates, but there was no shortage of good looking people by 2pm, mingling around, i was definitely & pleasantly surprised at the ratio!
Dissapointing experience. All the usual BS, not substance. The pool is tiny. Unless you get a $1000 habana, there's absolutely no point of going here.

Reserved 2 chairs through Issac, was quoted 300 and told be there early! Got in line right at 11AM and the two guys in front got 2 chairs on the spot for 225. Now I regret reserving ahead of time.

No champagne fire drill and we stayed till 5. Half of the chairs don't have any coverage in 112 degrees heat. The runners were not as attentive as Bare pool lounge. 

Might be back, but overall, it was somewhat meh.

Was staying at aria for birthday  and heard about liquid so I decided to treat my party of 8. Not very inviting for a day club pool. If your trying to lounge and relax don't bother staff was rude the wannabe pool cop was very rude with my whole party and really changed my mind for me before we entered.. being a dick to guests you want to frequent your business isn't the best promotion strategy.  Maybe get less abrasive tough guys to watch the line or lack thereof of a line. And thank Aria pool and staff they were great and the reason they got 2 stars instead of 1. They were also tipped well.

Pros: 
My friends and I got a day bed for $350 which means you can hang out in the bed and agree to spend at least $350 on food/drinks at Liquid. Bottles start at $550 and individual margaritas start at $14ish. While I had a great time, I could see why others without beds/cabanas wouldn't have enjoyed themselves as much because you could literally only sit around the rim of the pool. 

Drinks: we ordered margaritas and other cocktails. They tasted good and got to us within 20-30 minutes of ordering. The price was to be expected in vegas.

Service: super pretty bikini clad girls that were friendly but forgot our order multiple times. Drinks and food arrived in a reasonable time frame.


Cons:
Music: I can't understand why they played the clean version of every song. It's a 21+ venue, is it not? You're ruining my rap music! 
There was a live dj there... maybe he prefered the clean versions. 
DJ would not play Pretty Ricky.

The pool: it was small but it wasn't overcrowded. You could see the film of sunscreens and bronzer though...

The umbrellas: Once we were burnt to a cinnamon crisp, we wanted our umbrella moved or another one opened to protect our fresh sunburns. The server said there was nothing that they could do. Its too bad that the other umbrellas shading empty beds/benches couldn't be used.

Hours: The website says it's open 11am-6pm. We got there after 1pm and by 4pm staff told us that they were closing. They finally asked everybody to leave at 430pm. Wtf?!

Overall: I had a good time with my girls and I might even come back if our other first picks were full.

This place is run spectacularly and the customer service is top tier. Great crowds, fantastic music, and solid vibes all around. They really pay attention to detail - so much so that they took the time to fold all of our shirts! It was so cute! Obviously it's high priced, but a good value.
Super lame! Boring, poor service, expensive/ rude staff. Headed back to the Comso pool right across the street where it's much nicer instead.
A little small but quality... We did Rehab a few years back and I would come to Liquid again before Rehab.

I arrived at the pool on my birthday yesterday with a group of friends who came from Utah, Cali, and here in Vegas to help me celebrate.  I had on a shirt that said 420 because it happens to be my birthdate.  The guy at the door said that I could not come in because my shirt said 420, had pic of weed on it and that I was too high to come in.  Then he said but happy birthday anyway.  How does he know how high I was  and I don't think that is a requirement to get into a lounge anyway.  We went  to the Mandalay bay and had a good time there but that is the last time we party at Liquid Pool Lounge. Sucks.

I went there on Sunday for a bachlorette party right after we got off the plane. We had a bottle and a cabana and it was the perfect start to our trip! The staff was awesome and we had the best time..Can't wait to go back to Vegas and go back! Thank you guys!!!

I WAS having a great day at the Aria hotel, which I do still like. I had a really bad experience at Liquid pool lounge. I got there early and had to wait in line, they insisted on throwing away my Visine eye drops unless I wanted to spend twenty minutes going back to my room to drop them off. (I bribed another employee to hold them for me at a different part of the pool area) Then when I finally got in, they wouldn't let me use my room card to buy a drink so I spent $20 cash on a pina colada. Fine. I asked if I could sit anywhere and was informed that ALL of the seating had high drink minimums. I'm just one 103 pound person. I have to get WASTED AT NOON just to sit ANYWHERE??? It was small; it wasn't even European style and the music was beyond obnoxiously loud. Not going back. Well, I never even got to sit down at all, I had to leave. Feeling unhappy and unrelaxed. Bad policies.

I stayed at the Aria and my friend said she'd gotten a pass to get into the 21 and over Liquid Bar.  It later seemed that we didn't require the pass for our group of 5.  We found a set of couches to perch on.  Hot, Happening, Loud DJ, lots of folks dancing around the pool.  Some in the pool floating on inflatable donuts and throwing these plastic balls all around.  So fun!

No drink service - so we had to go up to the bar, I didn't mind, as long as it's clear.  
A great time.  It was a Sunday around 4pm.  The pool was super warm.  The max. depth was like 3'6".  
For drink I got a Mojito in a gigantic plastic cup.  My friends got the Watermelon Cooler cocktail.  Bartender's wearing bikini's, they definitely pulled it off.
I met a super cute Aussie guy who was into the coffee lid industry, but I couldn't hear a word he said, so that didn't go anywhere.

At the end of our stay, I was in the pool, lounging on an inflated donut and abruptly was told to leave, get out of the pool.  I took it sort of personal, but they weren't clear ----- it was for everyone.  Just random, we are closing....but then a few moments later, "All Right, First Person to Jump in!! Go!"  So, some weird tactic.  We had enough time there.  Just a big huge, Sunday, Re-Hab type pool party.  All ages - like some 20s year old and definitely 50s, so good crowd.  Not all gorgeous intimidating people.

Liquid pool is not what it is cracked up to be. When one goes to a pool club you would expect to at least be able to set your stuff next to you but they try to squeeze out every last penny that they can get for a crappy small pool. Left much to be desired and while some staff members were nice most wouldn't help you unless you had bought a bed. We couldn't even have our stuff right next to us in the pool. They then after we had been there for over an hour informed us that we had to check our draw string bag for $30. On top of this the environment was uneventful and not fun. Staff sub par.

Memorial Day weekend pool party was insane!!! 
The pool area is huge with plenty of cabana space. The dj was on point and played a great mix if you like to dance. 
The bottle service for the cabana area is very on point. They even have built in fridges with Fiji water and an array of other beverages. 
Best day in Vegas was at this pool party!!!

Ridiculous place. We are in a penthouse suite at the Aria and have rented a cabana at the Aria pool. Somebody handed us "VIP passes" ( please don't be impressed because I'm not) for "Liquid" so we wandered over there. Some ridiculous tiny penis body builder wanna be bouncer demanded we show picture ID.  Memo to management-get rid of the ego-maniac idiot and let 53 year old guys into your god awful place.  I'll just go back to my cabana  and spend ridiculous money on beers!!!

It is the best kept secret when Vegas gets windy! Got there just before the rush and snagged a bed, with full service: Food, drinks, towels, umbrella, a safe for valuables, a drawer to keep things dry, and all tended to by Jay and the best of all the girls...until we were transferred to a blonde girl who was more concerned about her looks than being paid. Great for meeting people and good music. Service was slow at times but they made sure my allergies were accommodated. 

Every towel dropped was replaced, drinks were poured for us, and didn't have to lift a finger. Just what you need for a day poolside. The pool was a good dance floor when it got warm. 

Closing our tab took far too long, likely because of the one girl. Once our original girl came back we were closed out in no time. I wish I could remember her name because she was absolutely phenomenal and made the whole experience what it was. Worth it!!

We came here to party and hang by the pool for my bachelorette party and we had the best time! There were 12 of us so we got a reserved lounge area (we did get there early to get a spot close to the pool) and had our own waitress who did an awesome job!

She did a great job keeping the drinks/shots and everything flowing! The watermelon coolers in their logo cups were awesome - so delicious! They were super accommodating to our larger group as well as many others I saw. The DJ did a great job with the music!

The facilities were super nice and we stayed pretty much all day! It had a good crowd, but wasn't overly packed, would love to go back anytime!!

Huge disappointment. 7 girls and I came here last weekend, getting onto a guest list and showing up early (free champagne for the ladies from 11-1). We then tried to sit down on one of the day beds, but were kicked off, as it had over a 1,000 food and beverage minimum. Even the lounge chairs were $150 each. "So where can we actually sit down or put our things?" "Ummmm.... in the pool is just about it," the bouncer told us. The place wasn't even 1/3 full. 

We went to the bar to put our purses down, and started enjoying the champagne. The DJ was absolutely horrible, and no one was dancing. This seemed like one of the places just to "be seen," loaded with fake boobs, fake tans, dude-bros, and the kind of people we escaped LA to avoid, just there to be noticed. We bounced after 30 minutes and went to Ditch Friday at Palms, where there was a much better time to be had!

The pool is ok, but really, the things they confiscate from your purse???...gum, tick tacks protein bars, hand sanitizer, deodorant. I asked if they were gonna do a full cavity search as well. Was not impressed with the service, and for that reason, I'd never go back there. You'd think with the thousands they charge for the cabanas they'd be a little more accommodating. They could give you a bag to keep the things they take out of your purse & let you grab them on the way out if they knew anything about customer service.
He didn't let us in in the pool because he said we didn't have a room key. We told him we are going to the liquid pool but he still didn't let us in.

Much like everything in Vegas this is set up to take your money. Free to come in if a guest of the hotel but all seating areas are $750 to start and higher! This goes towards food and drinks but why even throw that out.
Tiny pool.and service just okay.
Stay at the *regular* pool and enjoy the service from the hard working staff!
Shout out to Jocelyn! Great job...keep it up.

The swimming pool version of a VIP area in a club.  Staff is very rude, obviously they shouldn't have to put up with trash like us, 30+ professionals who want to chill out and buy drinks and food all day.  After giving up our first born to get in we looked around for 10 seconds and left.  Do yourself a favor and skip this place, get a cabana at the aria pool.  Way better.

This Adult pool is a lot of fun!   We bought the $100 food and drink minimum for each chair.  By the end of the day we had spent over $300 in alcohol.  We were there last weekend and they had a great DJ on Saturday that kept the party going on all day.  This is an adult pool, but not a topless one.  Many of the adult pools in Vegas are topless pools but this one is not.  Ladies, keep your tops on!  I think it's quite possible that this pool draws a lot of beautiful ladies in because they aren't expected to take their tops off like many of the other adult pools in Vegas.  One major downfall for this pool is that you can't have your drinks in the pool.  However, the water stays alot cleaner since people are spilling their drinks in it.  All in all this pool makes for a great day.  If you're staying at the Aria hotel you ought to try it out.

Less than impressed. Been to a few pool clubs this one the worst! Got there early and within three hours spent over $400. Once the pool was filling up we were ignored because we had no day bed. Even spending the minimum for the day bed we still were treated terrible. Not only did the staff not care but the waitress told me how much I need to put for a tip! Clearly she had no clue how terrible her service was. The only one who cared was a bouncer and the rest of the staff couldn't wait to get us out of there! Go at your own risk of being treated as if you don't matter even when you spend more than the minimum!

Well it started off great..., but don't expect to leave and get back in easily. As with any other club in Vegas the bouncers take their jobs VERY SERIOUSLY ! my husband and I spent about $350 for our 2 lounge chairs - drinks and food. We were very tame and well behaved I thought. However my husband wanted to take a dip in the pool outside of liquid and upon reentry to liquid stepped over the rope to come back in. Apparently a huge no-no as the bouncers all got worked up because my husband was not bowing down to them and begging to be let in again even though I was inside with a $350 tab going. That was a big dis for both of us. Being kicked out based on a bouncers feelings? We make a ton of money and like to spend it but never again at liquid. We feel we were treated like crap! Because of that we will no longer spend our $$ at any light group clubs, sorry!

I am just now getting around to writing this review almost a year later but the experience I had at this place still sticks out in my mind.  

Came here with a group of girls on a weekday.  We were told it was a big pool party so we got there at 11 am when it opened and waited in line.   We had to wait about 30 minutes while they let in a couple people at a time.  We were expecting it to be super crowded since they were only letting a few in at at a time.  It was super hot (which is fine since it was Las Vegas in June) but the guy at the door kept giving us the run around about why we couldn't just go in.   

We finally got in and there was absolutely NO ONE in there.   Every bed was completely empty except for two and only a few people were in the lounge chairs and a couple at the bar.    Now we had never been in one of these places so we didn't know we had to pay for a bed.   It was $1000 dollars for the bed which was crazy because there wasn't anyone there.    We did put our stuff down on the bed and were ignored for about 20 minutes until the "pool director" came over and informed us of the price.   My friend negotiated with her and since it was so slow we could have the bed but we would have to buy drinks.  My friend put an order in for 3 $25 dollar drinks and a bucket of 6 waters ($50).   We sat for about 40 more minutes and the drinks never arrived however the ladies that came in after us got their stuff immediately.  

We were super pissed so we just left but not without letting the waitress know how angry we were.  She played dumb and pretended like she was "so sorry" she forgot.   I don't think they wanted us in there to begin with.  

We went out of Liquid and over to the regular Aria pool where we had a much better time.  It was very relaxed and the pool was nice.

I was there this past Saturday and I could not believe the service provided by the bartenders. With the only exception of Jon, he was the only bartender that didn't seem to give attitude and enjoyed working there. The two other bartenders made me wonder if they were portraying discrimination towards minorities. The blonde chick with the wanna be blue feathers or strips of blue dyed hair had an ugly attitude. I swear if it wasn't because Liquid was the last stop, I would of threw my drink back at her. She had the nerve to give me a drink that was already served and not wanted. Hmm.. How is that ordering the drink I wanted?! Learn to be nicer to everyone, learn how to make drinks and look for another job because obviously you look like you hated it there.

The girl friends and I came out of Haze nightclub and one of the female promoters outside hooked us up for some free champagne at Liquid the next day. She kept us posted by sending out text messages and brought us to VIP status, which enabled us to skip the long lines. Score! We also received free drink vouchers if you "liked" their Facebook page. 

The pool itself was small, yet you can still have a great time splashing around with your girls and enjoy the free drinks. Sometimes, I love being a girl. I love you, Vegas.

Had a bottle and cabana for a bachelorette party at Liquid and it was so fun! The service was good and they were very nice to us. It was a Sunday afternoon, so it wasn't too busy, but was still a good time. Next time I wanna go for a party and see how bumping it gets!!

Where do We start.  Get ready to get discriminated on.  My wife and I will never go back to Aria Hotel nor the Liquid pool lounge in Vegas.  It's more like if they have a white Dj then "whites" are welcome and if they have a guess black Dj, then blacks are welcome.  The manager "buddy jah" flat out told rudely and racially told us we were not coming in because of the type of swimming trunks I was wearing. Meanwhile I wore the same shorts the day before.   He said get my name and make sure you spell it correctly .  Wow great service.  We ended up leaving our suite rooms and checked in to another near by hotel even tho we hade to pay more money.  It's all about principle.  
Stay away from Aria hotel.  Unless you're cool with cool with experience true racism.

The food poolside is horrible. Two of the servers were amazing but a third one were stuck with was as horrible as the food. Don't waste any money at the pool. Other than that, the amenities were typical. Towel service was the only saving grace.

Hysterical good time!  My bestie and I were at the Aria with our Mom's for the weekend and decided to break away for some youthful good times.  This place is ON for people watching and meeting interesting people.  The things we saw and the people we met were movie-worthy.  I swear I wrote this review already but it must not have saved properly. 

Anyway, thank you to the doorman who let us in without a fee.  Yes, after a certain hour aka 3 pm it's $20 for GIRLS to get in.  Okay the place closes at 5 pm.  So for the last two hours they were going to squeeze another $40 out of us rather than enticing us to come in and spend $100+ on booze and water.  The $20 per girl almost lost them the $100+ that I ended up dropping at the bar BEFORE tipping well.  Bad business model if you ask me.  I digress.  We were able to sit at a table with a nice couple who's boys (21 and 25) were in the pool.  Well, I guess the boys had a disagreement of some sort while in the pool and one ended up with a paramedic and a cut.  Que controlled chaos.  Perfect for people watching, so sad for that family, sorry.  Next up is a really nice group of Canadian guys who were very entertaining and genuinely nice.  Had everyone at Liquid been as kind and considerate, it would have not been as fun to sit and watch and chat.  But they were a breath of fresh air. Because all around us were groups of extremely intoxicated girls and guys (many on the older side - not judging just making an observation) eyeing one another up and down and probably peeing in the pool.  It was hysterical!  Reality TV could make a series about day clubs in Vegas and I would watch, without abandon, I would marathon crush those shows. 

Check out Liquid.  We had a great time. The people are nice, staff great.  Maybe don't swim in the pool late in the day but over all it was great and I will go back.

WOW! Talk about a tiny tiny pool filled with a bunch of drunk people. Stopped in on a Saturday, good thing we had some drinks in us because this place was pretty bad. 

- There is no where to sit unless you get bottle service, so bring your credit cards. 
- Overpriced for what you get
- The smallest pool I've ever seen

Honestly, this place was a pain in the butt unless you had bottle service. With so many other options, I would suggest going somewhere else.

However, we did have a blast! The drinks were cold, the music was loud and everyone was just having a great time!

Went during EDC weekend, and we had a great time. My sister and I got in for free on guestlist through my promoter, and once we got in we noticed no places to sit unless you had a daybed or table.  Since we got in early we were able to talk to a host and secured a table for our party of 4, for a reasonable minimum considering we would have spent the money regardless .  Food and drinks were good. This pool was definitely smaller than I was a expecting, but it gave more of lounge feel than club.  If you're looking for a good time and nothing too crazy then this place is perfect!

Don't waste your time here. Tiny, dead and they make you throw away all your water and food (goodbye Earl Sandwich :,( ). I've seen community pools at apartments bigger and nicer than this -.- So disappointing...
Don't waste your time going to Liquid, just hang out at the ARIA pool.  The bartenders at Liquid were really slow and rude. Also, the pool was really small. I recommend Wet Republic instead.

We were given free passes to Liquid so we thought that we would give it a try.  We liked the set up and concept.  A girl aka Katy Perry, asked for our cell phone number and set us up for the next day as VIP. Interestingly enough, after giving her my cell phone number, I got texts from other Vegas solicitors.  When we arrived, we were greeted by what looked like bouncers and screened.  Seriously, the pool was mostly empty, very few cabanas or lounge chairs were filled....And yet they had to do several checks on everyone before giving us the okay to enter.  Immediately, we were approached with the story about how the system works. You can not sit anywhere unless you pay...$200 for a chair, $1500 for a sofa thing, etc. All personal items must be checked in an amusement park setting locker area and you can use their towels but not sit on them by the pool.  We were in a group of 7. All 3 girls were accused of leaving a pair of red sandals by the steps of the pool.  None of us own a pair of red sandals. Their staff is rude and takes their job overly serious.  We would have gotten the $1,500 package but after being treated like outcasts, we decided to leave and have fun elsewhere.  Very odd experience, they act like its a very exclusive club yet anyone can get in because they pounce on you with free tickets in the casino. They need to go one way or the other.  Either charge everyone a fee to get in so that if you do buy a chair, table, etc., you are guaranteed a certain type of clientel. Or let everyone in and let them sit where ever.  Waste of time and money....stay at the hotel pool, go to the clubs at night!

I'm more of a day party/pool party person over nightlife so places like this give me life. 

I always stay at Aria so it's only right I visit Liquid.

I've always had a great time and the staff is great.

Rental lockers are right by the pool to store your belongings.

Hop in, flirt and let the DJ go in and you'll have a blast.

WOW! I'm impressed I like this day club a lot! I honestly had never heard of Liquid Pool Lounge until my promoter told me about it. I thought it would be worth a shot since Aria is a nice hotel so most likely they would have a great day club and I was right!

The music here is awesome! They played some hip hop, top 40 and had party beach music! I LOVED IT!

I went here on Saturday for my sister's bachelorette party. We weren't really in the mood to be at a pool party since we had just come from a buffet. We only planned on staying a few minutes but once we were inside I did not want to leave! It was pretty crowded but we found a spot near the speakers to just dance! I would love to come back!

This is just as nice as Encore Beach Club! OH YEAH AND NEVER GO TO WET REPUBLIC! THAT PLACE SUCKS! COME HERE INSTEAD!

Ugh. I really can't with Las Vegas "beach clubs" and "mega clubs". It's just not my scene to pay hundreds of dollars to do something I should be able to do for free. Always feels like a ripoff. 

With that in mind, the Liquid beach club at the Aria hotel and casino was a huge disappointment. Like other yelpers have been saying it is a very small pool with very basic lounge and cabana areas. Last year I attended TOA Beach and it had infinitely better pools and lounge areas. My boyfriend and I got in for free because we were guests at the hotel (thank goodness we did not have to pay a cover for that snooze fest). Once arriving the pool had maybe 10 people in it awkwardly sitting on the edge of the pool. 

We found out that all of the lounge chairs cost $215 FREAKIN DOLLARS just to have a place to sit. Are you kidding me? The three pools outside of Liquid are bigger and I can plop my butt down in any of those chairs for free. The whole mentality of treating these beach clubs like night clubs is ludicrous.

I was later talking to a guest who said that lots of people were interested in coming in and joining the "party" but once they found out how expensive the chairs were they left. It seems like a loose-loose for the Aria, no pool guests to create the party atmosphere and loss of money on cover charge and drinks. 

If I were to recommend a beach party it would be TOA on a weekend, being on the guest list, with a party full of women. Then you may have a good time at these "exclusive" clubs.

Unfortunetely I can NOT recommend the place to anyone. Stuff is really unprofessional. The guy at the entrance is very rude. I would say the management should be more careful hiring stuff. The place is super small.

I cannot talk about the crowd or ambiance because we could not stand it for more than 1 min. However I can say that the employees behave like they own the place, probably there is no manager.  No one pays to enter. Worst thing in Aria

This place is awesome. The staff are really nice. The place is spacious and comfy with plenty of cushioned benches, chairs and pads to lay on. Hot cocktail waitresses, nice bartenders, and a live DJ as well. The pool isn't too steep at all, so there really isn't much swimming involved, just lounging. They serve food here as well, and I tried a couple of items. The salad was alright, and the grilled chicken was cooked perfectly. It was tender with just the right mesh of ingredients. My friends told me that the burger was delicious! Overall, a great spot to hang out if you're at Aria.

Worst place ever!

First to get in I was practically strip searched.  They took my case of vitamins and showed at least three different security guards before they decided they were ok.  BUT I couldn't use any of them while in the pool area.  I had to make sure I didn't take them out.  F'ing dumb.  They're vitamins.  They then confiscated my tangerines.  I had three of them.  I always make sure I stash a few snacks on me in case my blood sugar gets low but they felt it was a security issue to have three tangerines.  It's seriously easier to enter the pentagon or White House than Liquid.  Oh, did I mention we spent over $1200 for the day?!?  Seriously?  I'm going to spend $1200 but I can't keep a couple of tangerines?!?!  The pool was small, the food was gross, the atmosphere was stupid, the DJ sucked.  The only thing I could compliment was the staff once we entered.  They always made sure to refill our drinks (with the $600 bottle of Kettle One we purchased).  This place is a joke - save your time and money.  F Liquid!

Liquid is Aria's answer to Wet Republic, Bare, Moorea Beach Club, Encore Beach Club, and just about every other day time pool party that the strip has to offer. It's managed by the Light Group, which also manages Bare. With that in mind, its like being at a nightclub in the day time with DJ's spinning music, alcohol being overpriced, and girls in skimpy attire. 

What does it have going for it? It's in Aria, which is a nice property. The facilities are top notch, but I still think that Encore Beach Club is a better bet for your daytime partying needs.

The pool was clean and really nice, kind of
Small in comparison to the other day clubs. But i enjoyed myself. It was my bday and we had a great time....
Slightly high on the prices but that's to be expected when visiting the day clubs. Service was GREAT. My table waitress was so friendly attentive and incredibly beautiful. 
We live here, and will def be back

I can't compare this to any other exclusive pool scene as this has been the only one my wife and I have been to. We had just planned on going to the regular pools at Aria when we spied this place and became curious. There was a podium we passed that had guys handing out VIP passes to young ladies walking by. When my wife and I stopped, they did their best to ignore us...it was actually quite comical....let's ignore the paying guests! LOL That's a strange business model. Finally one of the gents asked my wife if he could help her....she asked about the club and fees. He said she could definitely get in for free but that I would normally need to pay. But then he said it was fairly slow, so he gave me a pass as well. We didn't have our ID's so I ran back to the room to get ours. The club staff were actually fairly pleasant and helpful. We shared one lounge chair given the $100 minimum. It was after 3pm so we weren't going to splurge for two lounges. After 4pm, one of the staff came over and said we could take another adjacent lounge for free. The majority of the customers were 20-30 year olds and we're quite friendly and very amusing to watch. My wife and I likened the final bill to being the same as a show bill......except the customers were the show! We had two pitchers of margaritas and two bottled waters. The grand total was somewhere around $170.00 with the tip. The venue was cigar friendly, so I was quite content in sitting back, smoking my stogies, sipping on a margarita and watching the madness unfold. Actually, a couple of people came by and remarked how good my cigars smelled and wanted to know where I had gotten them. The staff seemed to be having as much fun as the crowd. One of the waitresses was thrown in the pool by a few of her coworkers. The music was bass pounding hip-hop....not exactly our thing but it was a great soundtrack for the spectacle. Overall we had a good time. The staff was very attentive....coming by to refill your glass, empty your ash tray and make sure you didn't need anything else. The club closes at 6pm and when we left we could very clearly see the lack of any vibe at the basic pools. They were nice...but very laid back. So, it's all in what you are looking for. The people watching value in Liquid was pretty priceless!

We just missed Jamie Foxx! Booooo =(

My friend's friend works for Liquid and told us about the free champagne until 3p. Beam me up Scotty! We had just 2 1/2 glasses each. The bartender was uber chill and had PERFECT teeth. There weren't very many people there since it was still early, but the crowd was very pretty to look at. Seriously, eye candy for all the boys and girls.

Liquid is pretty chill actually. They had OK music playing, didn't see a DJ but the music was pretty loud thanks to the speakers strategically placed everywhere. If you don't plan on sitting anywhere then you are all set. Majority of the seating areas are reserved, so we just sat at the bar.

Overall, it's a nice and chill. I'd go back.

I came during the week so it was pretty laid-back.  Got a pool-side daybed for a $375 spend minimum.  It's a small pool, but it was very clean and service was very good.  I actually enjoyed the food and drinks here better than Encore Beach Club.  The Mahi Mahi tacos, beer battered onion rings, and coconut shrimp were amazing.  They have great prices on bottles of champagne-$385 for 2 bottles of Moet Ice where Encore was $495 for one.  It's a good pool for when you need a chill day.

So we're in Vegas right now and it's raining. We go to liquid because we are staying in the aria and encore closed. It's slightly raining and we decided to go to liquid. There is literally no one there, not a single person in line. We walk up and the guy tells us we have to wait. Wait for what?! For him to finish his text message!!!! There are 5 of them standing there doing nothing and we have six people who were willing to spends a few k to get drunk....in the rain. Seriously?! We turned around and went to the aria bar. Amazing bar tender, warm hot tub. Still dumbfounded....

My girls and I came here and had a fun time, but nothing worth writing home about.  We got in without cover and got a free daybed, so we ended up ordering food to splurge a little. As good as the menu items sounded,  the turkey burger and fish tacos tasted bland.  The drinks were fine, the crowd was okay and the music was decent.  Our time there was fun but it's not worth any cover or any food/drink minimum. I say come visit if you happen to stay at the City Center. Worth the walk to peek in and look, but no need to take a taxi over here...not worth the $12.

So my party and I went to Liquid on the first Tuesday they were open this season. First off the security at the Aria didn't even know the day club was open. The staff at Liquid seemed nice but there was a total of 8 guests excluding my party at the club. They have plenty of lounge areas amd cabanas for a busy day, but having to spend 65 dollars for a pitcher to reserve a lounge area around a unexpectedly small pool didn't exactly seem worth wild. Maybe on a weekend in peak season it would be a cool day club, but it just wasn't for us when we went so we left after 10 minutes.

I won't go into detail, but let's just say I talked my way into a packed Boys Noize pool party for 4 friends & I without ever being on a guest list!

 I highly recommend getting on a list because you can't pull this stuff everyday & the girls behind us got turned away.  

Not only did we get in despite arriving pretty late in the afternoon, but we got in for free & got to see an amazing DJ do his thing!

Drinks here are expensive  BUT luckily we made friends with the boys w/ bottle service so the good times kept on rolling.

This pool is not too big, so unless you get here super early or reserve cabanas, you probably will not have a place to sit. However, there is plenty of fun party people in the pool tossing beach balls and enjoying each other's company. 

You can check your things in upon arrival (complimentary) so you don't have to worry about leaving your purse or wallet unattended & can go have a blast.

I would recommend this party for the younger crowd 20-30's. It is loud & fun & not for people looking to lay back and relax! 

Good place to go if you want to be social and dance!

LV Yelpers! 
Lookin' for a pool party?! Liquid @ Aria... is a must do if you're in the area.

I came here this past weekend, both Saturday and Sunday (I stayed at Vdara, so it was easy for me to just walk over without catching a taxi).

Saturday was great came around 1pm stayed till 6... weather was nice, packed with people and good music. That day, they charged $40 for guys and free for girls... with a $200 minimum per chair... which we wanted 2 chairs... but they could only offer us 1. On a good note, music was great! I danced for 5 hours straight and entertained all of liquid. Left with a lot of fans, lol. On an off note but not surprising, a couple was caught having sex in the pool and got kicked out.

Sunday came around 1230pm left at 330pm... weather wasn't great... windy... clouds over sun... there was a little sunshine here and there... but due to the weather, it wasn't as crowded as Saturday. People actually remembered me from the day before... guess I stood out with all that dancin I was doin. That day, they didn't charge cover for guys... but they wanted a $50 minimum per chair and there was 4 of us, so we spent another $200. It was so windy that day that one the lounge beds flew up in the air and almost landed on me! =( 

Yummm! I don't drink alcohol, so I was all about the food! Good stuff!
I had alot of food on their menu:
- ahi
- shrimp cocktail
- club sandwich
- coconut shrimp
- virgin pina colada
- virgin mango daiquiri 

- they even got us coffee, which wasn't on the menu.

$25 for liquid shirts. I love mines!

Bathroom is clean.

Except to wait 20-30 mins. for your bill.

Come here if you don't have a problem dropping $200 (food/drinks) for fun in the sun. Not super packed, so there's room to breath and dance!

-1 star for $200 for 1 chair... and not being able to accommodate us with 2 chairs. Paying that much $, they should make it happen!

I hope to return one day! Worth checkin out. Mixed crowd.
Don't forget your ID!
Enjoy my photos =0)

Lots of X&O to LIQUID! I miss U!

I got kicked out of the pool for smoking out of a vape pen, walked back to my hotel, threw on some new gear, and got right back in. #suckers.

The pool is kind of small compared to the other LV pool parties which is why I give it three stars tho.

Ohh emm gee ! I had amazing time here with my girlfriends. We went in a Thursday and has a blast. Great food, people and drinks. The music was amazing and we literally danced the whole time. The previous reviews do it no justice. This was one of my fav pool parties while we were in Vegas ! 

Food wise order the quesadilla it was super good and the chips and dip.

I am very disappointed in the way the staff treated me. I was a guest in the hotel and asked a staff member, Nicholas Fontana, for advice on places to go that night. He text me asking if I "take my panties off". Sexual harassment should be expected if u go here. Don't waist ur time at Liquid unless u want to be treated like a fucking prostitute. Go to the encore instead
